Major KUDOS and CONGRATULATIONS to BHS sophomore Merrill Keating for being accepted into the UW Robinson Center for Young Scholars. Essentially, Merrill will be starting university in the fall.

"What I‚Äôve taken from my years at BISD is that, even in a time that's as scary as it is now, you should never be afraid to take risks and step outside of the expected or your comfort zone. Believe in yourself and even when you feel drowned in darkness (my first book!) there is always light to be found.

The Spartonics 4915 robotics team was a highlight and influenced my choice of majors and even my career. I started with coding when I was very young and the opportunity to be on the mechanics sub-team and in leadership changed my life and my interest from computer programming to mechanical engineering and artificial intelligence. I am especially grateful for Warren Read, Wendy Kozina, Paul Meehan, and Enrique Chee ‚Äì teachers and mentors who inspire me and so many other students at BISD to think, be their best, and persevere." - Merrill Keating

March 21 at 11:12 AM ¬∑

You could focus on the ‚Äúbig picture‚Äù of the place or zoom in on one small area. Look, listen, smell, feel. Share what you noticed verbally or through drawings and written words in a notebook. Return to this spot once a week or every few days. What changes do you notice?
